review_title: Nice people but they don’t invest in employees

review_title: Financial Aid Department Management not up to par
job_title: Student Financial Aid Advisor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Working with students is always a pro for me. Knowing that I am able to help someone achieve their educational goal by helping understand how they will finance their education, affordably, is very rewarding!
cons: The Financial Aid Department is under-acknowledged. For the amount of work and effort that is required and expected, asking for a raise is like pulling teeth.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Time Flexibility Making a difference in student lives Great recognition programs
cons: The organization can seem to be "click-ish" No incentives for growth Linear thinking Poor communication / Poor systems and Processes

job_title: Sos Instructor in Anaheim, CA
pros: I enjoyed my co workers, students and my boss. The hours fit my schedule.
cons: Pushy about the Vax, demand meetings with last minute warning, communication for evening staff was horrendous. Borderline lies to incoming students, could call it misinformation to be nice...

job_title: Career Services Coordinator in West Covina, CA
pros: You can work independently but also as a team.
cons: No raises and little advancements.

review_title: Do Not Work For This Company - They Are Terrible
job_title: Registrar in West Covina, CA
pros:
The owner (Mitchell Fuerst) likes things to look nice - so everything seems good, at first...

Then you realize that the work environment is toxic and they change your timesheets without your permission because they don't want to pay overtime.
cons: The Success Education Corporation group of schools (North-West College, Glendale Career College, Nevada Career Institute) are all about the money and not about the students OR the employees. All of the top "executive" employees are cutthroat, backstabbing weasels (Beylor Meza, Nancy Aguillan, Brook Allen) that only care about staying in the inner-circle. Mitchell Fuerst is like an annoying salesman.

job_title: Technology Integration Specialist in West Covina, CA
pros: Back in 2013, my resume was found online and I was called in for a special project. I have been working directly with every team at the college ever since, and must say it has truly been a rewarding experience. I've personally grown and have been tasked with new projects that push me to learn and explore my abilities and discover multiple ways to help the company grow as well. I work with each campus, helping integrate new technologies into their classroom and lectures, as well as admissions and clinical staff. The owners of the company, and all other staff members truly care about student success and will do whatever it takes to make sure the students are prepared for the real working world outside of college. I've first-hand experienced a personal friend graduate the college and go off into the world with a rewarding career, I really believe in what they do here. I look forward to growing more with the company and expanding my abilities to help in any way I can! Thank you for the opportunity!
cons: None. Many of the issues I see here and complaints are very odd and unexplained. I've never encountered an issue with corporate, or any other staff members.. Everyone really does care about giving the best service they can to the students.

review_title: Over worked, under paid and in need of therapy
job_title: Receptionist-front Dest&/Registrar in Santa Ana, CA
pros: Campus close to home.  Staff/faculty at my campus, although a huge turnover,  became like my own family.
cons: Excessive work load, with unrealistic deadlines, etc. I was expected to  successfully perform (2) positions which I was not hired to do(front desk-recptionist/registrar) but thrown into or get fired. Same hrly $ and no raise in 3 yrs. Corp treats staff/faculty like dirt (depending on which campus you work at) unless of course you know someone in the inner circle!!!  It takes 3 people to answer a question, if it ever does get answered, because no one is on the same page ever, but, staff/faculty are still required to perform job duties at 100% w/o proper guidance, support,  training , pay, or respect from upper  management. No one has your back and if they find out your Un happy & stressed out mentally or physically from being overworked they simply ask "do you like your job" and really don't care if someone quits because only the "Corp inner circle" are of any value to them.  I personally felt abused and taken advantage of by them pilling on more and more duties on me then they threw me out like I was trash.

job_title: Executive Director in West Covina, CA
pros:
The President and Vice President truly care about their students and Team Members. They are hands on and they are quick to provide support whenever we need it. They encourage all Team Members to speak up and share our ideas and most importantly, they will never dismiss our concerns without listening to us first.

The best part about this company is we actually practice our Core Values everyday. Our President and Vice President believe in all of us and they give everyone an opportunity to advance and grow within the organization. 

I love coming to work because of the family environment and the support I get to accomplish my daily tasks.
cons: I can't think of any cons. Our President and Vice President may not agree with us on everything, but they will honestly listen and provide support. They actually take the time to get to know each one of us.

review_title: Good for work experience, Corporate needs fine tuning up.
job_title: Admissions Representative in Pomona, CA
pros: Loved working with students, my campus staff and launching careers.
cons:
They only offer part-time non benefited positions. 36 or 38 hours only so employees wont get benefits. pay is ok. nothing crazy. 

Admissions reps have a quota of enrolling 3 students per week. If you dont enroll 3, you have to be on a "opportunity" conference call where the Director of Admissions tells you how bad you did and how you can do better. 

The turnover rate for admissions here is high, they usually hire admissions reps every couple of months. 

Director of Admissions was extremely demeaning, condescending, and does not take the time one on one to actually train staff. 

Each program for students is no less than $13,000, with the most being $40,000. They should really take care of their employees financially.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Covina, CA
pros: That you have a job.  President and Vice President are never really there.
cons: Poor management, no team work, no proper training, fear of being fired every day, low pay but they expect you to do more than you were hired to do.  Vice President looks down on everyone especially the way you dress which is sad since they tell you at orientation how she was once poor and slept in her car.  Don't ever talk back to her or she will fire you in a second.  I've seen it happen.  The president is only there once a week if you're lucky.  The hard working employees are underpaid while upper management are paid to take 2-3 hours lunch and they come and go as they please.  Don't even try to work any overtime they will just delete any extra hours you work since their argument is that overtime was not approved.  I've seen one manager come in and go to lunch right after.  While most employees take their lunch when they have time and they don't even pay you meal penalty.

job_title: Administrative in West Covina, CA
pros: President & Vice President takes pride in their employees. They truly treat you like family and support, encouragement and praise for hardwork makes you feel appreciated and valued. Most of all North-West College values their students and actually wants every student to succeed. Company is still growing after 50 years in business. New students, prospective students and graduates are treated with respect and compassion. Management provide opportunities to grow you and showcase your talents in another Department. Great collaboration amongst teams in every Department.
cons: The ONLY challenge is working with a few miserable co-workers who dont honor or take pride in company's Mission Statement and just come to work for a paycheck. It's a challenge to work beside the VERY FEW negative employees but it can be done if one focuses on whats truly important which is their job to service the students.

job_title: in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Been with Company for 8 months. I have only great things to say.  Great Core Values. Very Accommodating and care about team members and the students.The longevity of employees speaks for itself. Employees have been with company  20-30 years +
cons:
My only problem is I live far from campuses and will relocate to continue to be a part of this Company. 
It always seems like the few employees that are unhappy always have something to say. The Employees that are happy don't always think to write a review. More should talk about the positives.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Covina, CA
pros: Family type atmosphere which you feel on many campuses. There isn't a high turn over with staff.  Training and support is available when ever needed.
cons: Many regulations in this type of business.  Sometimes you have to deal with students not wanting to take their education serious so you need to be encouraging and motivating.

review_title: Love my Campus Director and the NWC family!

pros: I really enjoy my job. The Riverside campus is like a family and the Campus Director is awesome to work with. I would like to make more but I wouldn't leave such a great work environment for a little more hourly.
cons: Who wouldn't want to make more money.

review_title: We will always strive to maintain a 'family' type atmosphere
